title: Teresa Marinovic
text:
Teresa Margarita Natalia Marinovic Vial (born 3 February 1973) is a <a href="Chilean%20people">Chilean</a>, <a href="columnist">columnist</a> and <a href="politician">politician</a> of <a href="Conservative%20libertarian">conservative-libertarian</a> <a href="ideology">ideology</a> who serves as member of the <a href="Chilean%20Constitutional%20Convention">Constitutional Convention</a>. She is known for her outspoken personality and confrontational approach to politics. 
She received a degree in <a href="philosophy">philosophy</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20the%20Andes%2C%20Chile">University of The Andes</a>, where for ten years she worked as teacher in courses of <a href="philosophy">philosophycal</a> <a href="anthropology">anthropology</a>, <a href="truth">theory of truth</a> and <a href="theology">theology</a>. She has also worked as a columnist for the Chilean newspapers <a href="El%20Mostrador">El Mostrador</a> and <a href="Las%20%C3%9Altimas%20Noticias">Las Últimas Noticias</a>, as well as in the multimedia area with <a href="Radio%20B%C3%ADo-B%C3%ADo">Radio Bío-Bío</a>. In 2018, she was appointed <a href="executive%20director">executive director</a> of the Fundación Nueva Mente, a <a href="libertarian">libertarian</a> <a href="think%20tank">think tank</a>.
She was elected as a member of the Constitutional Convention by District 10, receiving the second largest number of votes in the district and the largest number of votes of her <a href="electoral%20list">electoral list</a>: <a href="Vamos%20por%20Chile">Vamos por Chile</a>.
Early life.
Marinovic, of Croatian and Basque descent, attended secondary school at the Santa Úrsula School in Santiago. In 1991, she was accepted to the <a href="University%20of%20the%20Andes%2C%20Chile">University of The Andes</a>, where she received a philosophy degree with a focus on contemporary philosophy. She has stated that she supported <a href="Augusto%20Pinochet">Augusto Pinochet</a> regime and still defends its political work despite what she calls its "non-systematic" <a href="Human%20rights%20violations%20in%20Pinochet%27s%20Chile">human right violations</a>.
Political career.
Rising: Video-columns (2016−2020).
She began to become known due to her publication video-opinion columns shared on social networks on the Internet, where she gave her point of view on matters of interest to the Chilean national public opinion. Her editorial line was tendingly <a href="social-conservative">social-conservative</a> in value issues whereas <a href="liberalism">liberal</a> in economics. Likewise, she showed herself as an opponent to the governments of <a href="Michelle%20Bachelet">Michelle Bachelet</a> (<a href="centre-left%20politics">centre-left</a>; 2014–2018) and <a href="Sebasti%C3%A1n%20Pi%C3%B1era">Sebastián Piñera</a>, whom she criticizes since the beginning of his <a href="centre-right%20politics">centre-rightist</a> second government (2018–2022).
Through these platforms and his opinion columns, he has carried out political cyberactivism for different social causes, such as so that the owners who allocate their homes for themselves, do not pay more contributions that increase the price of housing in Chile, in addition to eliminate other taxes and payments to the State that, in his opinion, raise the cost of living in the South American country. He has been in favor of immigration in <a href="Chile">Chile</a> —as a positive factor for the economy— but against irregular immigration, harshly criticizing the handling of this issue by recent governments. During the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Chilean%20protests">2019–20 Social outbreak</a>, she was against the mobilizations, even sarcastically commenting on an incident that occurred between a policeman and a young man. Marinovic called him a "criminal" and also asked about the health of the young man "who was swimming in the <a href="Mapocho%20river">Mapocho</a> [river]."
At the end of 2020, she was proposed by <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Antonio%20Kast">José Antonio Kast</a>'s <a href="Republican%20Party%20%28Chile%2C%202019%29">Republican Party</a> to be included as a candidate for the <a href="Chilean%20Constitutional%20Convention">Constitutional Covention</a>, being finally registered with the Electoral Service on the list of «Vamos por Chile», the electoral pact of <a href="Chile%20Vamos">Chile Vamos</a> (Piñera's coalition).
Constitutional Convention (2021−22).
On 4 July 2021, Marinovic was invested as constituent. Nevertheless, that day was marked by riots outside the <a href="Palacio%20Pereira">Pereira Palace</a>, groups she harshly criticized and about –recording in live by <a href="Instagram">Instagram</a> through her cellphone– she had a tense debate with future president of the Convention <a href="Elisa%20Lonc%C3%B3n">Elisa Loncón</a>, who told Marinovic "why did you came here to provoke?".
Days later, in the fourth session of the Convention, she clashed again with the now president Loncón on Loncón's statements about the death of the <a href="Mapuche">Mapuche</a> <a href="Weichafe">Weichafe</a> Pablo Marchant in <a href="Carahue">Carahue</a>, who died in a confrontation with <a href="Carabineros%20de%20Chile">Carabineros de Chile</a>. Marinovic reminded that Loncón «is the president of the all Convention» and that her «debatable» opinions were unnecessary. Likewise, Marinovic has called <a href="Machi%20%28Mapuche%20spirital%20healer%29">Machi</a> <a href="Francisca%20Linconao">Francisca Linconao</a> a «<a href="dictator">dictator</a>». Then, in the tense ninth session of 20 July (due to the issue of <a href="human%20rights">human rights</a>), she directly criticized to Linconao for speaking in <a href="Mapudungun">Mapudungun</a> and not in <a href="Spanish%20language">Spanish</a>. Because to all of that, Marinovic was criticized by constituents like <a href="Ramona%20Reyes">Ramona Reyes</a> (<a href="Socialist%20Party%20of%20Chile">Socialist Party</a>), who considered Marinovic as a <a href="racism">racist</a> person. Later, the same day, she was faced by the constituent <a href="Valentina%20Miranda">Valentina Miranda</a> (<a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20Chile">Communist Party</a>), who told Marinovic to «keep that intolerance» for herself. Besides, Miranda assured said that to her in representation of who are of <a href="Mapuche">Mapuche descent</a>, reason why –according her– she weared the <a href="Colo-Colo">Colo-Colo</a> T-Shirt.
Two days after the controversy with Linconao, the <a href="centre-right%20politics">centre-right</a> constituent <a href="Hern%C3%A1n%20Larra%C3%ADn%20Matte">Hernán Larraín Matte</a> (<a href="Ev%C3%B3poli">Evópoli</a>) stated that: "I told Teresa Marinovic that I did not agree with the provocation she made". and that «all deserve respect». Elapsed the controversy, on 29 July, she received a gift from the poet Felipe Cussen: a Mapudungun dictionary for that «together let's learn this beautiful language»; she took the present with humor and published herself smiling with the dictionary on her Instagram account.
On 3 August 2021, she generated controversy after getting into a shouting match with <a href="Jaime%20Bassa">Jaime Bassa</a>, the vicepresident of the Convention.
Personal life.
She has nine sons of her first marriage, which she divorced.
Her current couple is the <a href="lawyer">lawyer</a> Enrique Alcalde Rodríguez, member of the <a href="Supreme%20Court%20of%20Chile">Supreme Court of Chile</a>.
